summary: Build Phase 6A: a secure Admin Access Page gateway to the Administrative Dashboard, protected by a 5-character master code and logging successful access for auditing, with responsive navigation placement.
architectural_notes: Admin Access Page must integrate with existing authentication and Administrative Dashboard systems (extend, do not replace).
Successful admin access events must be timestamped and stored in an Admin Access Log for auditing.
On incorrect master code, display only a generic 'Access Denied' message without security details.

existing_features.title:
Implement a protected Admin Access Page at route "/admin-access" that prompts for the five-character master access code "7583A" and, on correct entry, immediately grants access to the existing Admin Dashboard.

- On success: unlock the existing admin access gate for the current browser session and route the user to "/admin".
- On failure (including backend errors): deny access and display only the exact user-facing message "Access Denied" (no extra details).
- Ensure the input enforces exactly 5 characters (UI maxLength=5, and UI copy must refer to a five-character code, not a digit-only PIN).
- Do not display any security implementation details (e.g., do not mention multi-step verification, logging mechanics, principals, roles, etc.) on this page.

Update the site header navigation so the Admin Access Page link placement matches the requested responsive behavior:

- Mobile devices: ensure an "Admin" link appears in the top-right hamburger menu.
- Desktop/computer/TV screens: ensure an "Admin" link appears in the main top navigation bar alongside the other website pages, labeled exactly "Admin".

The link must navigate to "/admin-access" and must extend existing navigation behavior rather than replacing it.

Ensure the Admin Dashboard route "/admin" remains protected by the existing authentication and admin access gate systems, such that:

- Users cannot access the Admin Dashboard unless they have successfully entered the master access code during the current browser session.
- This gating behavior must extend existing mechanisms (e.g., the current gate/session approach) rather than replacing the admin dashboard implementation.
Ensure logging out clears any session-scoped "admin access unlocked" state so that, after logout, the browser session no longer has access-gate unlock privileges until the master code is re-entered.

new_feature_requests.summary: Implement Admin Access Page gateway requiring master access code (7583A), showing only 'Access Denied' on failure, granting dashboard access on success, and logging successful access with timestamp.
Add responsive navigation entry for Admin: in mobile top-right hamburger menu; on desktop/TV in main top navigation bar labeled 'Admin'.

Update the backend admin access verification so that every successful master-code verification is automatically timestamped and stored in a persistent Admin Access Log for auditing.

- Store at least: unique log entry id, caller principal, and a real timestamp (do not use a placeholder value).
- Only successful verifications must be recorded in this Admin Access Log.
- Keep (or provide) an admin-only query endpoint to retrieve the Admin Access Log for auditing purposes (do not expose this log publicly).

projectName: Phase 6A: Secure Admin Access Page gateway with master code verification, audit logging, and responsive navigation
